title: Update Linear sync workflow: on-deploy vs worker dispatch
description:
**Task:** Change the Linear sync workflow trigger from push-to-main to on-deploy, and structure it as a reusable worker that can be dispatched by the deploy workflow.

**Approach:**
- Current: `.github/workflows/sync-beads-linear.yml` runs on push to main when `.beads/issues.jsonl` changes, plus workflow_dispatch
- Target: Run Linear sync when deployment completes (on-deploy) instead of on every push; use workflow_call so the deploy workflow can dispatch it
- Convert sync-beads-linear.yml to a reusable workflow (`workflow_call`) that accepts no inputs or optional inputs
- Add a deploy workflow (or update existing) that runs after successful deploy (e.g., Render webhook, or a deploy job) and calls the sync workflow via `uses`
- If deploy is external (Render auto-deploy on push), consider: (a) a deploy-status webhook from Render that triggers sync, or (b) keep workflow_dispatch for manual sync and add a `workflow_run` trigger that fires after a specific deploy workflow completes
- Update AGENTS.md Linear Sync section to describe the new trigger behavior
- Files: `.github/workflows/sync-beads-linear.yml`, `.github/workflows/deploy.yml` (or new deploy workflow), `AGENTS.md`

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] Linear sync runs on deploy completion (or equivalent) rather than on push to main
- [ ] Sync workflow is reusable (workflow_call) and can be dispatched by deploy
- [ ] workflow_dispatch remains for manual sync
- [ ] AGENTS.md documents the updated trigger behavior

Projects page: Open filtered view in YouTrack (like bar chart links)
description:
**Task:** Add an "Open in YouTrack" action on the Projects page that opens YouTrack with the current filters applied as a report query — similar to the clickable bar charts on the home page.

**Approach:**
- Reference implementation: `src/pages/index.tsx` — `handlePriorityBarClick`, `handleStatusBarClick` build YouTrack query URLs; StatsCard uses `href` to link to filtered YouTrack views
- URL format: `{YOUTRACK_BASE}/projects/ATOP/issues?q={encodeURIComponent(query)}` — use `VITE_YOUTRACK_BASE_URL` or fallback `https://realbrokerage.youtrack.cloud`
- YouTrack query syntax: `type: Project` base; values with spaces need braces (e.g. `state: {In Progress}`, `priority: {3 - Low}`); multiple values comma-separated; negation via `-field: value`
- ProjectList (`src/components/ProjectList.tsx`) holds filter state: selectedStates, selectedPriorities, selectedRequestors, selectedAssignees, selectedInitiatives, stateFilterMode, priorityFilterMode, etc.
- Add a utility (e.g. `src/utils/buildYouTrackQuery.ts`) to convert ProjectList filter state → YouTrack query string. Map include/exclude modes to YouTrack query syntax.
- Add "Open in YouTrack" button/link in ProjectList header area (near Filters/Sort buttons) or in projects.tsx — when clicked, build query from current filters and `window.open(url, '_blank')`
- Search term (searchTerm) may not map to YouTrack query — consider omitting or mapping to summary/text search if YouTrack supports it
- Reuse existing patterns: `getYouTrackUrl` in ProjectCard/SimpleProjectCard for base URL; design system (ocean, breeze, accent) for button styling
- No server changes required — client-side only

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] "Open in YouTrack" button visible on Projects page when filters are shown
- [ ] Clicking opens YouTrack in new tab with `type: Project` plus current filter criteria (state, priority, requestor, assignee, initiative) applied
- [ ] Include-mode filters map to positive query clauses; exclude-mode maps to negation
- [ ] Values with spaces (e.g. "In Progress", "3 - Low") use YouTrack brace syntax
- [ ] Button disabled or hidden when no filters applied (optional — or always show with base `type: Project` query)
- [ ] Matches UX of home page bar chart / StatsCard links (new tab, same project/query format)
close_reason: Added Open in YouTrack button to Projects page toolbar. Builds YouTrack query from current filter state (state, priority, requestor, assignee, initiative) with correct per-value negation syntax and login name resolution for users.
